definition: to live to the (ripe) age of
to enjoy/to benefit/to have the use of

sentences.english: The Liberal Democrat from New Jersey died Monday. He was 89.
sentences.chinese: 劳坦柏是新泽西的自由民主党成员，享年89岁。
特科于星期五逝世，享年96岁。

sentences.english: Yamaguchi died Monday at the age of 93.
sentences.chinese: 本周一山口疆辞别了人世，享年93岁。

sentences.english: She died in 1817, aged 41, from an unknown illness.
sentences.chinese: 她于1817年死于一场疾病，享年41岁。

sentences.english: Zhuo Lin, the Widow of an Ex-Leader of China, Is Dead at 93
sentences.chinese: 卓琳，中国前领导人之妻去世，享年93岁。

sentences.english: Russia reformer and former president Boris Yeltsin dies at 76.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯前总统叶利钦去世，享年76岁。

sentences.english: In 1604, Ferenc died at the age of 47.
She died in 1993 at the age of 63.
He was honoured for Arthur and died last year aged 96.
sentences.chinese: 他因出演《亚瑟王》而获奖，去年谢世，享年96岁。

sentences.english: He died in 1679 at the age of 91.
THE mother of former President Sam Nujoma, Kuku Helvi-Mpingana Kondombombolo, has died at the age of 108.
sentences.chinese: 纳米比亚前总统努乔马的母亲辞世，享年108岁。

sentences.english: The actor passed away at the age of 54.
sentences.chinese: 那位演员过世时享年五十四岁。

sentences.english: Dr Lee, who was 61, had been in his post since July 2003.
sentences.chinese: 李博士享年61岁，自2003年7月任职。

sentences.english: Former snooker player Alex Higgins has died at the age of 61.
sentences.chinese: 前斯诺克选手阿历克斯希金斯享年61岁。

sentences.english: Wu died Friday night in Beijing at the age of 91.
sentences.chinese: 画家吴冠中于25日晚在北京去世，享年91岁。

sentences.english: Edison died in 1931, at the age of eighty-four.
sentences.chinese: 爱迪生于1931年去世，享年84岁。

definition: to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
to die/to depart from the world forever
to die/to depart this mortal coil
lit. to fly on a crane to the Western Paradise/fig. to pass away (idiom)
to die an untimely death (idiom)/to be cut off in one's prime
to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
see 駕鶴西去|驾鹤西去[jia4 he4 xi1 qu4]
